isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER RT-610 SERIES - REMOVE - INPUT SHAFT

step1.para: Remove the bolts from the front bearing cap. Tap against the drive gear from inside the case to move the bearing cap forward to break the gasket seal ( Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Move Bearing Cap Forward to Break Gasket Seal

step1.para: Move the drive gear and shaft forward as far as possible.
Remove the bearing retaining snap ring from the groove in the shaft ( Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Remove Bearing Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Hold the shaft in position and tap the drive gear forward to unseat the bearing from the case.
Use pullers or pry bars to complete the removal of the bearing ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Use Pullers or Pry Bars to Complete Removal of Bearing

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the groove in the I.D. of the drive gear ( Figure 29).

figure.caption: Figure 29. Remove Snap Ring From Groove in Drive Gear I.D.

step1.para: Pull the shaft forward and from the splines of the drive gear ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 30. Pull Shaft Forward and From Splines of Drive Gear

step1.para: If necessary, remove the bushing from the pocket in the clutch shaft.
Move the drive gear to the rear and against the 4th speed gear, engaging the teeth of the sliding clutch gear.
